Light, highly modular and above all cheap, the MS-06 Zaku II is arguably the most successful mobile suit design ever.
The MW-01 Mobile Worker was developed under the guise of heavy construction equipment but was actually an early Zeon mobile suit prototype.
The RX-75-4 Guntank is perhaps more of a self-propelled artillery piece than a tank, but it certainly gets results.
The G-fighter is a variable range fighter craft specialized to support the Gundam.
The MS-09B Dom is a heavy, yet incredibly fast unit, handily outperforming Zeon Zaku II:s and Federation GMs alike.
Calling the RX-79[G] ground type a Gundam is perhaps an overstatement - It is built from spare parts left over from the Gundam's development.
The production model Gundam-type is the RGM-79 GM: a fine mid-range fighter admittedly lacking the Gundam's close quarters competency.
The MS-04 Bugu was the high-performance prototype for the mass-produced Zaku, much like the Gundam was to the GM.
The MS-07B Gouf is designed specifically for Earth-based, close-quarter MS combat. Very, close-quarter.
The FF-X7-Bst Core Booster is a Core Fighter combined with a heavy-duty booster module, greatly improving speed, firepower, and operational stamina.
